website_summaries.verdict: The Lux TX500U strikes a balance between value and function, making it my top pick if you're in the market for a basic programmable thermostat.
pros: A large display, strong blue backlight and an intuitive control panel make the $30 Lux TX500U easy to recommend
cons: Its plastic covering is flimsy and fell off once during use

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this thermostat about 4-1/2 years ago, with LUX replacing the original after about one year due to the commonly reported low-battery problem. The current unit is about 3 years old and is now again flashing the low-battery error. While I was able to correct this using the reset procedure described in several other reviews, the reset only held for about 2 weeks before returning to the flashing low-battery state. Clearly, something is not right with these particular LUX models and LUX has apparently decided not to fix the glitch over the last 4 year period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Flanders

customer_reviews.title: It was fine for over a year then started giving Lo ...
customer_reviews.text: Update: Contacted customer service and had no problem getting the product replaced. I bought the unit April 2015. It has worked fine until a couple of months ago started giving Lo Battery warning. We changed the battery, and a few days later the warning again. I even bought a new set of duracell batteries and again it only "lasted" a few days. My husband tested the batteries and they are good. I come to read the comments and find other customers with same issue, but at least they got 2.5 years without the problem, for me is more like 1.5 if you count when the problem started. It should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Bear

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old LUX 500 (TX500PB) with this one, a TX500U, and it works great. Easy enough to install if you're ok with drilling drywall and handling 2 simple wires, labelling them carefully beforehand and reading the instructions. One issue - which at this point is completely typical with Amazon and it's hidden data etc. - is that I thought I was buying a TX500ue, but it's just a TX500u. Luckily it was still compatible with our heater. I'm just glad it didn't turn out to be half the size I expected, which is my common Amazon experience!
customer_reviews.author: Demis

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are good of course because I've tested them
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting low battery messages now for a couple of months even after I install new batteries! Batteries are good of course because I've tested them. Today was freezing and the furnace would not start at all. Installed new batteries and went through all the resets listed in the manual. No Go! I tried to call the tech support line and they couldn't take my call because their system was down. Drove to Home Depot, bought a Honeywell unit and got it going in about 15 minutes. Thumbs DOWN.
customer_reviews.author: John Hashimoto

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent programmable thermostat
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent programmable thermostat. Easy to install and easy to use. I especially like the fact that it lights up the display when you push one of the buttons. I would give it an excellent review even without my service experience. Had a problem after almost two years with the battery indicator. Even after changing the batteries (they recommend Duracell or Everready) and even using the system reset, the indicator showed low and then it began flashing a lo indicator. Point is that I emailed LUX at their tech support at techsupport@luxproducts.com and received an immediate reply. This was on a Monday. On Friday I received a replacement thermostat. OUTSTANDING service commitment!
customer_reviews.author: Peter from Maine

customer_reviews.title: It's a great thermostat, but don't buy it.  Buy the TX700U instead.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great thermostat, but don't buy it. Buy the TX700U instead. This one does one program for M-F and one program for S-S. The TX700U allows 7 different programs as well as the option to use one program for M-F and one program for S-S - and only costs a few dollars more. If you have any need for a "programmable" thermostat, it is like you need more than two different programs for the entire week, so the TX700U is the way to go. I have both now. They are easy to install and program - mine runs a pellet stove and I love it. The same (included) backplate works for both.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like these Lux programmable thermostats, I know have three of these and two of their higher end versions. The only issue I've had with this particular model is battery life. The first two I set up would eat up batteries in a few months. Lux customer service responded by sending me two new ones, updated models with return postage for the first two. The replacements are better, batteries last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: HFL

customer_reviews.title: Works great for only 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent controller but read my update. Works great and looks very nice. I am using 2 rechargeable AA ni-mh batteries (Eneloops) and they have lasted for over a year. Much better than other controllers that use AAA batteries which lasted for only a few months. Update 5/1/2017: Been using this now for 1 year and 7 months and it is showing the signs of low battery with fresh new / recharged batteries. Time to look for a new one. Update 5/9/2017: Received new replacement unit from LUX because the unit has a 3 year warranty and mine died after 1.5 years. All is good again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Y

customer_reviews.title: Batteries.  Look out.
customer_reviews.text: Late review? Yes, read on. A electronic device will either work flawlessly or completely fail, that's what people with electronics repair experience are used to seeing. Sometimes, degradations in performance occur to just one specific function of a device. In this case, the thermostat has suddenly decided to deplete a confirmed fresh set of batteries EVERY two weeks. Set number four since New Years has already cost me close to the purchase price of the thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: CFC

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning after a year of use
customer_reviews.text: Not quite a year and the unit is repeatedly draining fresh batteries over the course of a week.
customer_reviews.author: RainbootedRobot

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Lux 610 unit since 2002.it wasn't back lit which was a pain.It was still working fine,but I decided to upgrade to the TX500e,It took me about 30 minutes to Install.The back lit works for ten seconds when you push any button( you have to push the button again if you want to change something)I've had this for a week and I live it!Works on 2 AA alkaline batteries and your power source(if you have one)I called Lux support before I bought this and when I received it(I had some questions) I recommend Lux(I'm NOT a Honeywell Fan)
customer_reviews.author: Smileyface

customer_reviews.title: Died in Five Months
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a thermostat you bought in May that died in November. Wasn't bad to program. Decent features. Could have used a backlight. But all moot when it lasted five months. Worse, only the heat function died, so I suckered into a technician service call to show me the thermostat was bad. Good when they work. But they need to get credit for this lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald C.

customer_reviews.title: Saves us up to $40.00 per month now...
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for several months now. Our old thermostat just had one setting. So it was always coming on when we weren’t home because nobody thinks to turn off the thermostat every single day before the leave for work. This is such a great price for how many settings it has. My power bill has gone down significantly. Saving me nearly $40.00 per month. It’s exactly what we needed in our home and didn’t cost an arm and a leg to obtain.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Installed quickly, generally easy to program, maintains even temp
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat installed quickly and was generally easy to program. The anticipation feature seems to work well as the room is much closer to the daytime set point in the morning now than with the prior thermostat that did not have that feature. I am testing to see if the thermostat is smart enough to start pre-heating the room earlier after colder nights than on warmer nights (if not, then it's just like setting the temperature to switch from night to day earlier, something you could do by yourself). Minor nit is that the illuminated display is pretty dim.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce H

customer_reviews.title: A great new thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a TXE 500 that lasted 12 years. It would have lasted longer but the green and yellow wire from thermostat shorted at the junction where it ties into the furnace. We noticed this when the blower stayed running when thermostat was off. Fixed that problem and noted that old thermostat would not work. So this was purchased at a great price compared to buying at big box home store. I really like the backlight display and larger numbers on this model. Easy to install in the old holes for the screws or new holes can be made if not replacing a Lux thermostat. Screws and plastic drywall anchors provided with thermostat. Vacation hold.
customer_reviews.author: subwo

customer_reviews.title: ... large (don't need reading glasses) The programming options are great including "the deadband" factor such that the pellet st
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2- one for pellet stove and one for heat pump I stagger their operation ---- use pellet stove when outside temperatures are below 38F Display is large (don't need reading glasses) The programming options are great including "the deadband" factor such that the pellet stove or heat pump don't keep turning on and off when the house temperature drops just one degree below set point-- should make the heating units last longer( much less cycling on/off)
customer_reviews.author: Rob06

customer_reviews.title: Lux Tx500U
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't hold the temp very well. Always have to change it. Would not buy this again. Update 1/23/19. This never worked properly. Heater would cycle over and over and sometimes just didn't come on at all and never seemed to stop at the hold temperature. Won't be buying anymore Lux products. Just replaced this with an Emerson 1F80 and it is working just the way it should.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Worked...until Low Battery
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat worked great for a couple years. Unfortunately, it also got the dreaded Low Battery issue. The first time it popped up, I was able to reset the entire thermostat using some tips from other reviews. It started having the same issue again about 6 months later, and now, even when I reset the entire device, it continues to burn through a pair of batteries in a couple days. No matter how many times I reset it, it doesn't fix the issue. I have 3 different models of the LUX thermostats, and I'm hoping they don't all have this issue. Don't get this one, it will cause lots of frustration long term.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: installed one 5 years ago, picked it for the aesthetics, quite unique back then, especially for the price. Replaced it because of the dreaded "battery error", tried everybody's fix - not worth the wasted time. Clicked right into the old base, highly satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Elsaesser

customer_reviews.title: Battery sensor issue
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a thermostat and is easy to install. Beware of battery sensor issues. After a year and half the battery sensor said low and to replace the batteries. I put several sets of new batteries in (Energizers and other brands) and the thermostat says all the batteries are low. Seems to be a TX500U issue since the other, much older, Lux thermostat still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: accurate and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: this was very very easy to install. (I had a very old mercury thermometer before) works well....I did have to go online for more instructions but it wasn't painstaking or difficult. I only yelled at it once, so not bad.
customer_reviews.author: erindvr

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, company stands by their product
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased this product almost 2 years back. It works really good. When I replaced with new batteries after a year of use, there was a small issue wherein it lost all its charge in a month. When I contacted the company support, the gentleman tried to trouble shoot it for me. At one point he realized that there was some code issue. He was kind enough to send me a whole new replacement, free of cost. I'd recommend them for standing behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Arun M

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 9 months. For the last month it flashes for "low batteries". Changed the batteries several times and tried 3 different brands of batteries to no effect. Programming has no memory so every time the batteries are changed it has to be reprogrammed.
customer_reviews.author: The Rick

customer_reviews.title: It has an adjustable differential heat setting.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth thermostat I've installed in the last month or so. This one works. Granted I have a unique hybrid hydronic heating system. The water is headed in a boiler, run through pipes to a water to air heat exchanger (radiator). The problem with the other three thermostats were that they cycled the boiler on and off to often This thermostats has an adjustable heat differential/swing setting of +/- 2.25°. I now have it set for +/- 1.25°. I set 70 and it turns on at 68.75 and off at 71.25. The perfect balance for my system.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M Howe

customer_reviews.title: Good thermostat, though I ended up giving it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good thermostat, though I ended up giving it to my brother when I realized I needed a 7 day programmable one since Fridays are so different from the rest of my week (M-T) and Sundays are different from Saturdays. I kind of feel like there are not a lot of situations where a 5-2 is worth it compared to a 7 day one but the thermostat itself is solid, no complaints from me or from him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well for one and a half years on ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for one and a half years on one set of batteries. Now it is going through a set of batteries in less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: KOVARIKS

customer_reviews.title: Noisy garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Not only do fresh new Duracell batteries trigger LO Batt... But there is a good awful high pitch noise everytime the backlight turns on. Posting a video so noone else suffers with this trash. Will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Low

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality; Low Battery Flashes Constantly
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and installed about 18 months ago and has already developed a malfunction; LO battery warning continuously blinks even after installing new batteries. Very disappointed as I've got other thermostats that have lasted 5-10 years and still working properly. Cannot recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Craig K. Lindberg

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked just fine at first...however, it started eating batteries and constantly shows low battery or discharged battery, even after I replace with fresh batteries. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: RUTH

customer_reviews.title: Not 2 stage cooling compatible
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get ti use or install, it is not a universal thermostat because it does not work on two stage cooling, only two stage heating. I need a tstat that is two stage cooling compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice now, hoping this LUX will last longer.
customer_reviews.text: Its OK. I replace a previous LUX unit with this one because I could no longer update the settings because the buttons were non responsive (really had to press HARD). I hope this lasts longer than the previous model. I hate replacing stuff every 7 years or so. Old thermo's lasted decades...
customer_reviews.author: E. S.

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend - drains battery in days! Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in October 2016. Worked fine until October 2017 when I also got the "Lo" message and the unit started draining fresh DURACELL batteries within days. Keep changing them but it keeps happening. Apparently there are many other experiencing this issue too. Replacing today with a Honeywell. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tara B. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: LOYAL LUX CUSTOMER
customer_reviews.text: I have always had a positive experience when purchasing a Lux product. This time was no different. I received my item quickly and very professionally packaged. I am not very tech inclined, so I called the tech number. My call answered right away by an actual live person! He patiently walked me through the installation process, and my new unit was properly installed in no time. Works perfectly. I can even read the display with having to put on my glasses. Very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: New York Mom

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: The programmable feature is good, but this thing eats batteries like you wouldn’t believe, and every time you have to change the batteries, you have to put in your settings again...
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. West

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this one
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions carefully and it worked just the way it promised the first time. It has continued to do just what it is supposed to ever since. Even my sister-in-law has learned to change the settings (which may not be a good thing) so the programing is easily understood.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur David Digby

customer_reviews.title: Yesterday and today.
customer_reviews.text: I was given a LUX programmable thermostat 18 years ago by the gas man giving a annual check up, it worked flawless for 18 years. I wonted to update so I saw no reason to try another brand, The Lux tx500u worked great first time, easy to program & install, very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Dorman Brandon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. It is simple and inexpensive, even easy to install following the removal of the one it is replacing. I only wish I would have considered the 5-1-1 version because my Saturdays and Sundays are used differently. Just something to consider. Other than that, and excellent investment for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: This product has been great. It's easy to program
customer_reviews.text: This product has been great. It's easy to program, easy to install. It keeps the temp perfect and had helped bring down our power bill. The only issue was the directions were a little hard to understand and in order to get clearer ones (about setting the cycles)---it advises you to go online. But would I buy it again? Yep.
customer_reviews.author: JerZyTattoos

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 1+ years, then failed with false "Low Battery" warning and wrong temps
customer_reviews.text: This LUX model TX5000U thermostat worked as expected for over a year, then failed with incorrect low battery warning and not turning off cooling even when actual temp was below AC/cooling set point. Replaced unit with identical one just for quick and easy snap-in fix --- hopefully this next unit will last longer than original one.
customer_reviews.author: JG in VA

customer_reviews.title: Greatly improved model!!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the original model which died after about a year.
customer_reviews.author: thomas pallan

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: Had some installation issues. My old thermostat had 10 wire and was ancient. Tried to research and figure it out on my own. Gave up and installed the old one. Months later (yesterday) I called tech support and they walked me through everything within a few min. and now works perfectly. Thank you Joel from LUX Tech Support!
customer_reviews.author: Razorback

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for really old gas heating unit
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. For some reason I'm unable to set the time. Following instructions and the thermostat does not respond as it's supposed to for changing time. Tried their customer support line, but they have very restricted hours of operation. Regardless, unit works itself other than that.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Simple, value priced thermostat
customer_reviews.text: The installation instructions could have been clearer. Took me awhile to figure out the correct wiring. The fact that my old thermostat didn't have any wiring indications on it didn't help. Programming was very easy. I'm fine with the Weekday/Weekend program settings. Much cheaper than the $140 thermostat that the local heating guys wanted to put in (plus labor).
customer_reviews.author: Russ Wyborski

customer_reviews.title: avoid
customer_reviews.text: To make my garbage cans heavier a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: sore feet

customer_reviews.title: Lux thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was right on time, and this is a great thermostat for the money. I purchased this to replace the thermostat that failed at my rental property. The tenants love it, it is easy to program and works great. I also have a Lux Products unit in my home. After seeing this one, I might just replace mine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for old round Honeywell t-stat
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic thermostats! They work perfectly with my 3-wire hydronic valves, and are a wonderful programmable replacement for the old round Honeywell mercury thermostats. They are so easy to install! Seriously, it takes almost as long to open the plastic blister-packaging as it does to install the thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Feiertag

customer_reviews.title: ... this to replace an older model that had gone bad. I love the lit screen that is dim ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older model that had gone bad. I love the lit screen that is dim enough not to be a nuisance. The screen light turns off after a few seconds of being on. Fairly decent instructions but someone who doesn't have fun installing something like this might not find the directions as easy. The programming might be dicey for some people too.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pellet Stove
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for use with my Ecco Choice CAB50 Pellet stove. Perfect t-stat for this stove since it has the variable swing and low voltage input necessary to work properly. Super simple installation and function. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Works with pellet stove
customer_reviews.text: Used this thermostat to control a pellet stove. It was easy to install and works well
customer_reviews.author: Mack46

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Really pleased with this purchase. Love the digital readout. So much better than a manual. Can't beat the price either. Seems to be very accurate. Thank you Lux.
customer_reviews.author: SubDeb

customer_reviews.title: My husband is brilliant.... Awesome thermostat too!
customer_reviews.text: After visiting the lux website and finding the correct thermostat to update my ancient one, I decided on this model. It looks awesome and works great. Install was super easy for my husband, however he is a genius so everything is simple for him. Matter of fact I don't think that there's anything he cannot fix. PS he smells wonderful too
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lumbert

customer_reviews.title: A possible fix for the dead battery issue
customer_reviews.text: Remove the batteries. Hold press and hold reset 15 seconds. Jump battery contacts with a test light for 15 seconds. Press and hold rest again 15 seconds. Insert batteries. This hokey pokey worked for me. I think the jumper with a consumer (test light) is what really fixed it. Good luck & best wishes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T

customer_reviews.title: Great and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Its a great easy product to use and install and Lux has a great customer service. You'll notice 1 degree difference here and there but besides that its awesome Must change batteries once it runs out Tech told me its lasts a year or so Runs on 2 AA batteries
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Simple but good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and does a good job keeping the house at a comfortable temperature. We had an ancient mercury thermostat before that only turns on and off, so the programming feature thing is amazing by comparison. Our gas bill went down by $50. Wish it didn't wiggle so much on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in FreeFall

customer_reviews.title: I got a dud.
customer_reviews.text: Never could get it to work. Hire someone else to install it & still no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install has just enough bells and whistles to justify the price do not try to install rechargeable batteries it will give you low battery warning. use regular batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: I mis that the newer Lux thermostats don't display both ...
customer_reviews.text: I mis that the newer Lux thermostats don't display both the set temperature and the temperature in the room. Having the Hold button visible is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: kevin grady

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Let's me raise the temperature in the house in the evening before I go to bed and lower the temperature back down to wake up to a cooler house through the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Birdman1965

customer_reviews.title: Performs well but Low Battery error after 3.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Troublefree but for the now-well-known, false Low Battery error, which showed up after 3 1/2 years of use. The hardware reset procedure described by others fixed it for me.
customer_reviews.author: FMA

customer_reviews.title: I really like everything about this but one thing
customer_reviews.text: I really like everything about this but one thing. The way the cover flap opens could have been designed better. If you're not careful you might end up taking the whole unit off. Besides that a great product for the price. It replaced an old analog thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy one that replaced a previous one that ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy one that replaced a previous one that had failed after 10 years. These work well and are intuitive for programming.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use. Not a lot of bells and whistles. We haven't taken much time to set it but what we've done which is just the basics was easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price for a weekly schedule timing or just a daily timing.
customer_reviews.author: ber

customer_reviews.title: Constant Low Battery Warning
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of these a year ago. Two always say low battery even with brand new batteries. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt S

customer_reviews.title: It's getting hot in here
customer_reviews.text: Low cost option for those who want to upgrade to a programmable thermostat. I was able to install the thermostat in under 10 minutes. This was my first thermostat installation and the instructions were easy follow. This product is highly rated on other consumer review sites.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Have had a while now & no problems easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Helen V Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed tech support for wiring info. They were very helpful and gave me the correct wiring information for my older system. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: "Lo Batt" warning issue; common problem
customer_reviews.text: Seems like "Lo Batt" warning a common issue with this unit. Replacing batteries doesn't help. Haven't tried the reset procedure outlined in other reviews but, since the unit failed on a weekend and I wanted A/C *now*, I ended up replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy D

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and I can actually use it in the dark ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my central air and heating. Looks good and I can actually use it in the dark when I've shut all the lights off for bed. Does what competitors units do and does so at half the price. Took one star off for the flimsy door, but in functionality and price it deserves 5.
customer_reviews.author: Like Life

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and a bargain
customer_reviews.text: I replaced another Lux Thermostat with this one so I did not need to replace the housing, just the programming faceplate. The previous thermostat lasted about 3 years. Decent bargain and Very easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Jason Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Good  quality
customer_reviews.text: Wire codes are hard they should be standard! The swing funthion is poor? little if any change!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my broken thermostat with this one. Selected it from more than 10 other models, mostly based on supported videos. Works excellent! I wish only it has a little more powerful back-lit.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Adamov

customer_reviews.title: Failed after two years.
customer_reviews.text: This device failed after just two years. It was a replacement for a similar make and model that lasted 16 years. Not sure if this is normal or if I got a dud, but I don't think it was worth it. Recommend spending the extra dough on a Nest Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install! Saves power by automatically changing the temp
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install! It is nice not having to adjust the thermostat every day! Just make sure to read thru the instructions if you are unsure about anything. I am pretty handy around the house so it was a breeze for me to install.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Set and forget.  front lid is hard to open
customer_reviews.text: The front lid is hard to open. Product is flimsily build. But then it's a thermostat and how often do we touch it. it's set and forget. It does work. I buy this one cause I have a new variable fan furnace with multistage burner.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Straight forward installation information and - if it's not in the documentation they sent - you can find additional info on their web site.
customer_reviews.author: CodingChris

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest thing to install in my home! I love it. I was able to hook it up on my own because the instructions were very clear. It works great and I am happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Easy instalation and programming.

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the newer version TX500Ub
customer_reviews.text: TX500Ub doesn't allow you to adjust the swing temperatures. The swing is important for systems like mine to prevent short cycling. Short cycling kicks the HVAC unit on/off every five minutes, and this is not energy efficient or safe on the HVAC system. TX500b's swing is programmed for a 1.4 swing, which is +/- 0.7 degrees from the set-point. Traditionally a swing is +/- 1 or 2 degrees. Don't order this if you don't like your unit cycling. I want the TX500U, but it seems like it has been phased out.
customer_reviews.author: Online Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and easy to operate. They are. But they don't hold up. I bought 7 of them and 3 have now failed within 3 years. These are thermostats. They are attached to a wall. They aren't thrown around or abused. NONE should fail within 3 years. Unacceptable.

product_meta.title: Lux Thermostat Program 5-2 day with selectable smart recovery, universal compatability
product_meta.description: About the LUX TX500U Thermostat, 5-2 Day Digital Programmable Universal Smart Temp Are you looking for a simple way to save energy in your home? Now you can live a greener lifestyle by upgrading to the LUX TX500U Thermostat, 5-2 Day Digital Programmable Universal Smart Temp. This programmable thermostat is not only energy-efficient, but it is also extremely cost-effective and attractive, blending in seamlessly with the rest of your home. The LUX TX500U makes it easy to give you the warmth you want, whenever you want it, whether it is as you’re waking up in the morning or heading to bed at night. Don’t worry about this being a complicated device to operate—the large, lighted one-touch display on the device makes using the LUX TX500U a breeze! It is also extremely easy to install, making it the perfect choice for users everywhere. Need additional reasons to trust the LUX brand? The company has been manufacturing outstanding products for nearly a century, and the device comes with a three year limited from the manufacturer. This thermostat is not for use on electric baseboard heat (120\240 volt) and systems with 2-cooling stages
feature_bullets: Great for heating and cooling systems including single and multi-stage heat pumps
Universal compatibility for all system types except electric baseboard heat
Exclusive Lux speed slide for easy programming
Separate weekday and weekend programs with 2 or 4 periods per day
